title: 103_s1940
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk, so the summarized curr_chunk is: "ALLOCATING APPROPRIATED SPENDING." The curr_chunk is: "Committee on Appropriations Resolution amends Section 302(b) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to allocate budget outlays and new budget authority among subcommittees after a concurrent resolution on the budget is agreed to." The joint resolution reported under this paragraph in the Senate shall have limited debate time of 20 hours. The Committee on Appropriations will manage the joint resolution, and its allocations will only take effect once the resolution is enacted into law. Other committees will allocate budget outlays after a concurrent resolution on the budget is agreed to. The committees of the House and Senate, excluding the Committees on Appropriations, must subdivide allocations among subcommittees or programs and report the subdivisions to their respective Houses. Amendments are made to the Congressional Budget Act regarding the allocation process. The Budget Act of 1974 is amended to allow for alterations of allocations by the Committee on Appropriations, subject to approval. Committees can propose alterations after reporting allocations, which must align with actions taken by the House on related legislation. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO APPROPRIATIONS BILL. Section 302 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to allow floor amendments to appropriations bills that reduce budget authority and relevant subcommittee allocations, as well as discretionary spending limits for the fiscal year covered by the bill and the following four fiscal years. The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to allow floor amendments to appropriations bills that reduce budget authority, subcommittee allocations, and discretionary spending limits for the fiscal year covered by the bill and the following four fiscal years. Conference reports on appropriations bills must include reductions in allocations and spending that are at least as much as those in the bill passed by the Senate or House of Representatives. SEC. 4. SECTION 602(b) ALLOCATIONS amended to require Committee on Appropriations to make allocations in accordance with section 302(b)(1).
